notes: As S. taeniopterus have a flat/truncate tail FL and TL values should be interchangeable. Original values are reported for fish lengths in mm and 'a' values were reported as log10(a) for mm. To convert to a standarized 'a' value for fish length in cm we first took the antilog of the log10(a)할.e., 10^a. Then we converted a from mm to cm by multiplying a * 10^b according to fish base conversion instructions (https://fishbase.mnhn.fr/manual/fishbasethe_length_weight_table.htm)
reference: Bohnsack J.A. and D.E. Harper 1988. Length-weight relationships of selected marine reef fishes from the southeastern United States and the Caribbean. NOAA Tech. Mem. NMFS-SEFC-215:31 p.

notes: Length-weight relationships are not available for this species in Bohnsack and Harper 1988 therefore we used Fishbased Bayesian L-W estimates based on species of this genus with a similar body plan.
reference: Froese R.; J. Thorson and R.B. Reyes Jr. 2014. A Bayesian approach for estimating length-weight relationships in fishes. J. Appl. Ichthyol. 30(1):78-85.
